data.title: Richard Jefferson sides with â€˜Courtside Karenâ€™ Juliana Carlos over LeBron James
data.meta_description: One former Cavalier isn't on Team LeBron this time.
data.text:
One former Cavalier isnâ€™t on Team LeBron this time.

Retired forward-turned-YES and ESPN analyst Richard Jefferson was caught liking multiple Instagram posts from Juliana Carlos, who earned 15 minutes of fame and the LeBron James-blessed nickname â€œCourtside Karenâ€ after her raucous actions during Monday nightâ€™s Hawks-Lakers game.

â€œrichard jefferson is doing lebron dirty by liking all of courtside karenâ€™s pics on instagram,â€ the Twitter account @buckets wrote shortly after the game, accompanied by four screenshots of Jefferson liking Carlosâ€™ photos.

The 40-year-old Jefferson played for eight teams throughout his 18-year career, including the Cavaliers during Jamesâ€™ return to Cleveland. The pair won the NBA championship in 2016 and are close.

Jefferson, perhaps jokingly, did not rebut the accusation and even went a step further.

â€œWait you guys can see that? ğŸ¤¬Iâ€™m in her side,â€ he wrote in a quote-tweet just moments later.

Carlos â€” who claims to be 25 years old on social media â€” was one of four fans ejected from Atlantaâ€™s State Farm Arena on Monday after engaging in a verbal altercation with the Lakers star during the fourth quarter. She held up both middle fingers while being escorted out and posted an expletive-laden video on Instagram claiming James was the one who started the feud by cursing at her husband, Chris Carlos.

â€œI donâ€™t have an issue with LeBron,â€ she said. â€œI donâ€™t give a fâ€“k about LeBron. Anyway, Iâ€™m minding my own business, drinking my [beverage], having fun. All of the sudden, LeBron says something to my husband, and I see this and I stand up. And I go, â€˜Donâ€™t fâ€“king talk to my husband.â€™ And he looks at me and he goes, â€˜Sit the fâ€“k down, bâ€”h.â€™ And I go, â€˜Donâ€™t fâ€“king call me a bâ€”h. You sit the fâ€“k down. Get the fâ€“k out of here. Donâ€™t fâ€“king talk to my husband like that.'â€

After the game, James, 36, coined the nickname â€œCourtside Karen,â€ which was trending on Twitter for hours afterward and prompted a flood of #CourtsideKaren memes.

â€œCourtside Karen was MAD MAD!!â€ James tweeted following the Lakersâ€™ 107-99 win in which he recorded 21 points, 7 rebounds and 9 assists.

â€œAt the end of the day, Iâ€™m happy fans are back in the building,â€ James told reporters post-game. â€œI donâ€™t feel like it was warranted to be kicked out. There was a back-and-forth between two grown men. We said our piece, he said his piece, I said my piece, and then someone else jumped into it and said their piece. I didnâ€™t think they shouldâ€™ve been kicked out, but they mightâ€™ve had a couple of drinks, maybe, and they couldâ€™ve probably kept it going and the game wouldnâ€™t have been about the game anymore, so the referees did what they had to do.â€

The Lakers move to 16-6 this season after Mondayâ€™s win and will face the Nuggets (12-8) at the Staples Center on Thursday.
